page.title: 19MINERAL WEALTH OF ST.AGNES
page.content: THE LAND AROUND ST.AGNES IS RICH IN MINERALS. THERE ARE NUMEROUS DERELICT TIN MINES WHICH ONCE WERE THE CENTRE OF A THRIVING COMMUNITY AND THE VERY HUB OF CORNWALL'S PROSPERITY. THE DECLINE IN TIN MINING BEGAN EARLY IN THE 20th CENTURY WITH A DROP IN THE PRICE OF TIN. OTHER MINERALS SUCH AS ARSENIC MADE MINING A VERY UNHEALTHY OCCUPATION. TODAY IN AREAS SUCH AS {CLIGGA HEAD}PEOPLE CAN STILL SEE THE RELICS OF THIS INDUSTRY. DERELICT BUILDINGS, CAPPED MINE SHAFTS AND DISUSED QUARRIES COVER THE AREA. WALK ALONG THE{COASTAL FOOTPATH}TO HANOVER COVE, HERE IN THE CLIFF FACE CAN BE SEEN MUCH OF THE MINERAL WEALTH OF THE AREA. THE STREAKS OF COLOUR FROM THE TIN AND TOWARDS THE BASE OF THE CLIFF THE TURQUOISE GREEN OF COPPER.
